description: Least m such that 1+prime(n)*2^m is a prime, or -1 if no such m exists.
comments: Primes p such that p*2^m+1 is composite for all m are called Sierpiński numbers. The smallest known prime Sierpiński number is 271129. Currently, 10223 is the smallest prime whose status is unknown.For 0 < k < a(n), prime(n)*2^k is a nontotient. See A005277. - _T. D. Noe_, Sep 13 2007
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n=1..1000
Ray Ballinger and Wilfrid Keller, Sierpiński Problem
Seventeen or Bust, A Distributed Attack on the Sierpinski problem
mathematica: Table[p=Prime[n]; k=0; While[ ! PrimeQ[1+p*2^k], k++ ]; k, {n, 100}] (Noe)
crossrefs: Cf. A046067 (least k such that (2n-1)*2^k+1 is prime).
author: _Labos Elemer_, Jan 10 2001
